result.execSummary:
The defendant Brittany Marie Konieczka was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Brittany Marie Konieczka
Current: 103 Polk Ave South, Frederic, WI 54837 United States  (Effective: 11-03-2015)
Prior: 200 Polk County Plaza, Balsam Lake, WI 54810 United States

3:05 Defendant Brittany Marie Konieczka in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. OSullivan files an amended information with 4 counts. Guilty to amended charges in amended information. probation: expungement. Chapman states agreement was 2 counts.3:07 Court recesses. 3:08 Court resumes. Counsel agrees OSullivan will file a second amended information. former counts of 3-4 will be read in for restitution purposes. Chapman and Def agree.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant. Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas guilty to the amended information containing 2 counts; Chapman stipulates to a factual basis.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds and adjudicates Def guilty to Ct#1 and Ct#2; which will be contained in an 2nd amended information to be filed later today. 2 uncharged counts will be read in for restitution. OSullivan and Chapman address sentencing. Def addresses the Court. Court: 2 years probation: each count concurrent and to probation from St Croxi County. conditions: costs on each count, expungement available upon successful completion of probation, $1050 restitution.   Appeal rights are given to the defendant.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 11-03-2015 02:45 pm.
